hero.title: Prepare for Takeoff
hero.subtitle: Everything you need to know before the alarm clock rings
hero.description: We know waking up at 4:30 AM requires willpower. Here is the operational manual to ensure your journey to the launch site is smooth, safe, and stress-free.

sunriseRitual.label: THE SUNRISE RITUAL
sunriseRitual.title: Why so early?
sunriseRitual.description: A hot air balloon is the only aircraft that floats within the wind rather than cutting through it. To do this safely, we need the atmosphere to be perfectly stable. This phenomenon, known as "inversion," only happens in the first hours of the day. Once the sun heats the earth, thermal currents begin, and it becomes unsafe to fly balloons. We don't fly at dawn for the romance (though thatâ€™s a bonus); we fly at dawn for the physics.

shuttle.cardBody: If you booked a package with transport, our van picks you up directly from your hotel or Airbnb in designated zones (Reforma, Polanco, Centro, Roma/Condesa).
shuttle.perks: The Perks: AC, seatbelts, and a nap on the way back.

selfDrive.cardBody: If you have your own vehicle, the drive takes about 45-60 minutes from central CDMX (traffic is non-existent at this hour).
selfDrive.parking: Parking: We offer secure, enclosed parking on-site at no extra cost. Your car is safe while you are in the clouds.
selfDrive.disclaimer: Do not guess. Use this Waze/Google Maps link directly to our Globoport.

weatherPolicy.label: WEATHER POLICY
weatherPolicy.title:
Fairness First: Our
 Cancellation Policy.
weatherPolicy.description: We are the only company with a strict "No Fly" rule if the wind is tricky. We don't take risks. But we also don't take your money if we can't deliver.

companyCancellation.title: If We Cancel (Bad Weather):
companyCancellation.description: You get a 100% Refund or a free reschedule for the next available date. No hidden fees, no arguments.

24to48.label: 24 hours
24to48.description: Non-refundable (The logistics and perishable breakfast are already in motion)

onionStrategy.title: The Onion Strategy
onionStrategy.description: It is crisp (and sometimes cold) at 6:00 AM, but by the time we land and have breakfast, the Mexican sun is warm. Wear layers. A jacket you can remove is your best friend.

footwear.title: Footwear
footwear.description: We launch from fields, not runways. Wear comfortable, closed-toe shoes (sneakers or boots).

luggage.title: Luggage
luggage.description: Please bring only small backpacks. Large suitcases can be stored securely at our reception, but they cannot fly in the basket due to weight and space.

afraidHeights.question: I am afraid of heights. Will I get dizzy?
afraidHeights.answer: Surprisingly, no. Vertigo usually comes from a connection to the ground. In a balloon, you are detached. The motion is so stable you could balance a coin on its edge. Most nervous flyers are smiling within 2 minutes.

bringCamera.answer: Yes, you are welcome to bring a camera. We recommend a camera with a wide-angle lens to capture the beautiful views.

breakfast.question: What is the breakfast like?
breakfast.answer: We serve a traditional Mexican breakfast with fresh fruit, coffee, and a light meal.
